item.description:
Climbing Nepal's Mera Peak (Potluck & Slideshow)

with Phill Hunsberger

6:30 PM Potluck, 7:15 PM Slideshow

AMC Auditorium
4 Joy Street
Boston MA

Mera Peak stands at 21,247 feet above sea level, as the tallest “Trekking Peak”, those peaks with little or no technical climbing involved. This peak is in the Mount Everest region of Nepal. For 10 days in October of 2007, Phill Hunsberger and his team struggled uphill with cold, damp tents and the effects of the altitude to arrive at the summit. It took only 3 days to return to Lukla airport where the trek started. This was a difficult camping trip, but with strong sunshine, spectacular views and porters to carry our gear, the trip was one of Phill's life’s highlights.

Phill has been an AMC member since 1997. He has led hikes and backpack trips with the AMC during most of that time. Having a nephew living in Kathmandu, Nepal has made it easy to visit and trek in some exotic places. Phill has visited all 48 of New Hampshire's 4,000 Footers and is about to finish the 35 3,500 foot peaks in the Catskills, NY during the Winter. Many times during the '80's and '90's, Phill was in Boston on the third Monday in April to run the Marathon. Phill is a retired Landscape Architect and spends much of his time making pottery and wood working. (Phill lives in PA and is traveling all the way to Boston to do this slideshow!)

If you plan to attend, please RSVP to Julie LePage at AMCBostonSlideshows@gmail.com.

For those who wish to participate in the potluck at 6:30, feel free to use the following guidelines: Last names beginning with K-Z bring a main dish while last names beginning with A-J bring an appetizer or side dish. Homemade dishes are great, store bought goodies & takeout are equally welcome. Plates, bowls, cups, cutlery, napkins and drink pitchers will be supplied. The auditorium has a kitchen if you need to do any re-warming or prep (stovetop, oven, microwave, sink, fridge, etc).

Subway Directions: Take the Red Line T to Park Street Station and walk through the Boston Common uphill towards the State House & Beacon Street. Continue walking up Joy Street, which runs along the left side of the State House at a set of lights. The Auditorium is #4 Joy Street (just before the AMC Headquarters Building, on the left side).
item.name: Climbing Nepal's Mera Peak (Potluck & Slideshow)
